result.execSummary:
The defendant Alex James Kranz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Alex James Kranz is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Alex James Kranz was found guilty of Burglary-Arm Self w/ Dangerous Weapon [Modifiers: as a Party to a Crime, Penalties for Felonies-Class "E" Felony], a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(2)(b).
  • Alex James Kranz was found guilty of Theft-Movable Property >$10,000 [Modifiers: as a Party to a Crime, Penalty - Theft >$10,000, Penalties for Felonies-Class "G" Felony], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Alex James Kranz was found guilty of Theft-Movable Property-Special Facts [Modifiers: as a Party to a Crime, Penalties for Felonies-Class "H" Felony], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Alex James Kranz was found guilty of Criminal Damage to Property [Modifiers: as a Party to a Crime, Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "A"], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).
  • Alex James Kranz was found guilty of Theft-Movable Property <=$2500 [Modifiers: Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "A"], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Alex James Kranz was found guilty of Theft-Movable Property-Special Facts [Modifiers: as a Party to a Crime, Penalties for Felonies-Class "H" Felony], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
-All Counts to run concurrent.
-Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and the Substance Abuse Program.

-If a Wisconsin State Prison sentence is imposed, outstanding financial obligations shall be paid from all inmate money at a rate of 25% and the balance due as a condition of extended supervision. 

In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.
Concurrent with: all Counts

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Evenson. ADA: Matthew L Hartung and ADA Ed Minser DF ATTY: Daniel James Chapman DF: Alex James Kranz appeared from jail. Case called at 10:36. Court reads charges and maximum penalty. Court reviews PSI. Restitution worksheet has been filed. Atty. Chapman updates the court as to the summary of the PSI. ADA Hartung updates the court as to the restitution regarding the vehicle which will be joint and several with the other party. A restitution hearing will be set. ADA Hartung gives sentencing recommendations. Victim give statement. Atty. Chapman gives sentencing recommendations. 
Court orders; 
Ct. 4- 10 years total, 5 years initial, 5 years ES
    
Ct. 5- 7 years total, 2 years initial, 5 years ES 

Ct. 6- 4 years total, 1 year initial, 3 years ES

Ct. 7- 6 months jail

Ct. 8- 6 months jail

Ct. 9- 4 years total, 1 year initial, 3 years ES 
*all counts to run concurrent to Ct. 4
Court notes 260 days credit against sentence. 

Conditions of ES:
- Restitution (to be determined)
- DE shall have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, David. M.,Tammy M., Brandon M., Lacy G., Charles S., Jeff G., Ashley V. and Kristen A. The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person. 
- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
- De to continue with AODA programming and any additional programing recommended by the agent. 
- DE to maintain mental health treatment and take all prescribed med as directed, DE to keep all appointments.
- DE to complete cognitive therapy/MRT.
- DE to complete a victim empathy panel. 
- Random and regular testing.
- Not to associate with any persons known or suspected to be involved in use, trafficking, dealing or manufacturing of illegal drugs except in a treatment setting.
- Maintain employment or education.
- DE not to ever possess body armor or a firearm. 
- Costs on all counts.
- Submit DNA sample and pay surcharge.

DE is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program. Court would prefer this programming. 
DE is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program. 

DE is remanded.
Atty. Chapman will be filing an appeal which can be visited at the restitution hearing.
Sentencing hearing on June 2, 2016 at 10:30 am.
Filed by ADA Hartung.  km              SRN signed 5/23/16 - dismissing Counts 1 -3. eif

Prior criminal records identified with dates to be provided by 05-16-2016. #7-#10 granted  narrowing down the witnesses. #11 granted, #12 - #14 granted. #17, 18 deal with at the next hearing. #19 has been dealt with. Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Evenson. ADA: Matthew L Hartung and ADA: Edward Minser DF ATTY: Daniel James Chapman DF: Alex James Kranz appeared from jail. JURY TRIAL DAY 4. Case called at 8:26 outside the presence of the jury. State has amended Ct 5. Court has prepared 12 verdict forms. Court reviews jury instructions. Court proceeds with the party to the crime. Off the record at 8:45. Case recalled at 9:11 in the presence of the jury. Jury instructions given by the Court. ADA Minser closing arguments at 9:47. Closing argument by Atty Chapman given at 10:27. ADA Hartung rebuttal at 10:46. Atty. Chapman responds to photo. Court reads verdict forms to the Jury. Court recieves the tumbled list and notifies the juror to be excused. Oath to Bailiff at 11:07. Jury out to deliberate at 11:08. Atty. Chapman responds to a sidebar yesterday. ADA Minser responds. Case recalled at 11:39 to discuss exhibits. Atty. Chapman would like #105, #12 to go back to the Jury. ADA Minser responds and does object. Court notes request and denies it. ADA minser gives the court EX. #118 to be a part of the court record.Case recalled at 12:31 for jury question off the record outside the presence of the jury. ADA Minser responds to the jury question. Atty. Chapman responds. Recess at 12:34. Case recalled at 1:02 outside the presence of the jury. ADA Minser argues. Court questions. Atty. Chapman responds. Court finds the party to the crime does not apply to the arming self while in the enclosure. Recess at 1:22. Case recalled at 1:32. ADA Minser updates the Court. Court out at 1:38. Recalled at 1:51. Court reviews previous rulings. Court rules, the arming is an element and the party to the crime statute applies. Adjourned at 1:56. Case recalled at 2:43 in the presence of the jury with a verdict. 
Jury finds the DE guilty of Amended info Ct. 4  verdict 1 conviction entered
                              guilty of Amended info Ct. 5 verdict 2 conviction entered, found $10,000 or greater
                              guilty of Amended info Ct. 6 verdict 3 conviction entered
                              guilty of Amended info Ct. 7 verdict 4 conviction entered
                              guilty of Amended info Ct. 8 Amended at the close of evidence to misdemeanor theft verdict 5 conviction entered
                              guilty of Amended info Ct. 9 verdict 6 conviction entered 
Jury polled
Jury out at 2:50 ADA Hartung makes a motion that the court accept the verdicts. Atty. Chapman makes a motion. Court denies motion. Court at this time accepts the verdicts. On motion of the state Court revokes bond. 
DE is remanded.

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Evenson. ADA: Matthew L Hartung  DF ATTY: Daniel James Chapman DF: Alex James Kranz appeared from jail. JURY TRIAL DAY 3. Case called at 8:45 in the absence of the jury. ADA Minser updates the court as to what will be testified to. Atty. Chapman argues. Atty. Minser argues. Att.y Chapman responds. Atty. Minser responds. Court rules, Mr. Gleason can testify to the effects of meth on him but not the effects of meth on the DE. Court will permit Mr. Gleason to testify to meth use but that will be it. ADA questions the Court for clarity. Case recalled at 9:06 in the presence of the jury. S/T J. Gleason. Direct by ADA Minser. Ex. #116 Detective Willems report. Jury out at 10:16. Off record discussions. Recess at 10:18. Case recalled at 10:35. Cross by Atty. Chapman. Redirect by ADA Minser. Recross by Atty. Chapman. Jury question. ADA Minser follows up. Recess at 10:53. Case recalled at 11:06 in the presence of the jury. S/T J. Dorosz. Direct by ADA Minser. Ex. #106 O/R and permission to publish. Cross by Atty. Chapman. Jury question. Recess at 11:41 for lunch. S/T Sergeant T. Feroni. Direct by ADA Hartung. Ex. #108 O/R with permission to publish. Cross by Atty. Chapman. S/T Lieutenant G. Willems. Lieutenant G. Willems identifies the DE in court. Ex.#65-71 O/R. Ex. #72-88 O/R. Ex. #117 O/R with permission to publish.Recess at 1:34. Case recalled at 1:42 in the presence of the jury. Exhibit ##117 is played for the jury. Cross by Atty. Chapman. Redirect by ADA Hartung. Jury Question. Follow up by ADA Hartung. Case recalled at 3:21 in the absence of the jury. DE is excersising his right to remain silent. Court accepts DE waiver to testify. Jury in at 3:31. State has rested. Evidence is closed. DE has rested. Jury to report at 8:30 tomorrow. Jury out at 3:33. ADA Minser amends the the information to a misdemeanor theft and argues. Atty. Chapman responds. Court will reserve on the motions. Adjourned at 3:53 for the day.

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Evenson. ADA: Matthew L Hartung and ADA: Ed Minser. DF ATTY: Daniel James Chapman DF: Alex James Kranz appeared from jail. JURY TRIAL DAY 2. Case called at 8:32 outside the presence of the jury. Jury in at 8:36. Continued Direct by ADA Hartung of Mr. Mason. Ex. #80 O/R with permission to publish. Cross by Atty. Chapman. Redirect by ADA Hartung. Jury question. ADA Hartung follows up for Jury question. Atty. Chapman follows up.  S/T B Mason. Direct by ADA Minser. Ex. #92 O/R and permission to publish. Ex. #76 and 82 O/R with permission to publish. Cross by Atty. Chapman. Redirect by ADA Minser. Recross by Atty. Chapman. Recess at 9:47. Case recalled at 10:07 in the presence of the jury. S/T M. Preliminary hearing at 09-28-2015 08:00 am

-It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Holiday Station located on Crestview Hudson WI,  H.M.S. dob 8/10/71 or M.J.E. dob 11/15/1997.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

-Not to possess any weapons as defined by Wisconsin law.

Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.
